meta.title: COVID-19 Resources and Information - Wissahickon School District

COVID-19 Resources and Information - Wissahickon School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasLeftBanner fsHasFooter fsHasTwoColumnWideLeftLayout fsSection1448 fsHasTheme3

div.h3: True Blue with a Heart of Gold

li.a: Q&A Regarding COVID-19 Protocol at WSD
Technology Support for At Home Learning
Q&A Regarding COVID-19 Protocol at WSD
Technology Support for At Home Learning

a.data-page-name: Q&A Regarding Coronavirus Protocol at WSD
a.span:
Click here for Q&A responses
to Coronavirus protocol at wsd

a.title: Teaching and Learning Resource Center
a.span: Click Here to go to the Teaching and Learning Resource Center

p.br: FREE Internet Access: Comcast Internet Essentials: Comcast is providing free internet through their Internet Essentials Program to support remote learning programs.

div.p: Grab and Go Meals for Students: FREE meals to students in the Wissahickon community. Meal pick-up is available on Tuesdays and Thursdays until further notice.
Montco Anti-Hunger Network: A comprehensive list of food pantries available throughout Montgomery County for families.
Commonwealth of PA Financial Assistance Information: View the section For Individuals for information about unemployment compensation, rent/mortgage assistance, utilities, etc.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is closely monitoring the 2019 Novel Coronavirus. The CDC website is updated frequently with information about the coronavirus (see CDC WEBSITE for additional information).

The CDC recommends a set of typical, common-sense precautions such as washing one’s hands, staying home when sick, etc. The CDC website (see above link) has additional details on these precautions as well as information that pertains to topics as international travel or pre-existing healthcare situations.

Procedures are in place in our schools, and always have been as a matter of prudent emergency planning, to respond to any reports of communicable illness such as the 2019 Novel Coronavirus. The Pennsylvania Department of Health issues guidance and direction to health-care providers and schools when necessary. Guidance has been provided to health care providers in the state for suspected cases of this virus. The Wissahickon School District complies with the direction of health agencies such as the Office of Public Health of Montgomery County and the PA Department of Health in matters of communicable illness. If there were a confirmed case of 2019 Novel Coronavirus in our community, the Office of Public Health would immediately notify us and provide guidance and information for distribution to our families.
We will update this webpage whenever we receive additional information that can be of assistance.

br.a: PA Department of Health Coronavirus Fact Sheets
Department of Homeland Security Pandemic Information
Fact Sheet: Montgomery County Department of Health

div.h2: Travel Advisory from PA Department of Health regarding Coronavirus COVID-19

p.br: Per the PA Department of Health’s website (see link below), students, parents/guardians and staff members are asked to please comply with the guidance as it relates to recent travel. This list of countries is as of today (3/6/20) and can of course change as more information is known, so please revisit the link if you have returned from travel or will be traveling. This is a critical piece of the overall strategy for keeping the Coronavirus COVID-19 as contained as possible. THANK YOU.

p.b: If you have returned from Iran or China:

ol.li: The health department will be alerted by CDC and will contact you
Stay home and self-isolate yourself for 14 days after travel

p.b: If you have returned from Italy or South Korea:

ol.li: Call 1-877-PA-HEALTH (1-877-724-3258) to let the health department know about your travel
Stay home and self-isolate yourself for 14 days after travel

div.p: Any travelers returning from Iran, China, Italy and South Korea should self-monitor for symptoms like fever, cough, or trouble breathing. If you become sick, call 1-877-PA-HEALTH (1-877-724-3258) and the doctor's office or emergency room before visiting.

div.p: The Wissahickon School District is committed to providing material on its website that is accessible to our students, families, staff and general public. If you experience difficulty with the accessibility of any material on our website, please visit our accessibility web page and complete the contact form to request our materials in an alternate format.
